abacus: An abacus is a calculating tool that has been used since ancient times, consisting of rows of beads on rods.
abandon: To abandon means to leave completely and finally; forsake utterly; desert.
abandoned: Abandoned refers to something left unused or neglected, such as a building or vehicle.
abandonment: Abandonment is the act of leaving someone or something without intending to return.
abate: To abate means to reduce in amount, degree, or intensity; lessen.
abatement: Abatement is the reduction or elimination of a nuisance or problem.
abbey: An abbey is a monastery or convent supervised by an abbot or abbess.
abbot: An abbot is the male head of an abbey of monks.
abbreviate: To abbreviate means to shorten a word or phrase by omitting letters.
abbreviation: An abbreviation is a shortened form of a word or phrase.
abdicate: To abdicate means to renounce or relinquish a throne, right, power, or responsibility.
abdication: Abdication is the formal act of stepping down from a position of power.
abdomen: The abdomen is the part of the body between the chest and pelvis containing digestive organs.
abdominal: Abdominal refers to the area of the body containing the stomach and other digestive organs.
abduct: To abduct means to carry off or lead away illegally, especially by force or fraud; kidnap.
abduction: Abduction is the act of taking someone away illegally by force or deception.
abductor: An abductor is someone who illegally takes someone away by force or deception.
abeam: Abeam means at right angles to the length of a ship or aircraft.
aberrant: Aberrant means departing from the right, normal, or usual course.
aberration: An aberration is a departure from what is normal, usual, or expected.
abet: To abet means to encourage or support someone to commit wrongdoing.
abeyance: Abeyance is a state of temporary disuse or suspension.
abhor: To abhor means to regard with extreme repugnance or aversion; detest utterly.
abhorrence: Abhorrence is a feeling of extreme repugnance or aversion.
abhorrent: Abhorrent means causing or deserving strong dislike or hatred.
abide: To abide means to accept or act in accordance with a rule or decision.
abiding: Abiding means enduring without change; lasting.
ability: Ability is the possession of the means or skill to do something.
abject: Abject means extremely bad, unpleasant, and degrading.
abjure: To abjure means to solemnly renounce a belief, cause, or claim.
ablaze: Ablaze means burning fiercely or brightly lit.
able: Able means having the power, skill, means, or opportunity to do something.
able-bodied: Able-bodied means physically fit and healthy.
abloom: Abloom means covered with or abundant in flowers; flowering.
ablution: Ablution is the act of washing oneself, often for ritual purposes.
abnegation: Abnegation is the act of renouncing or rejecting something.
abnormal: Abnormal means deviating from what is normal or usual, typically in a way that is undesirable.
abnormality: Abnormality is an abnormal feature, characteristic, or occurrence.
aboard: Aboard means on or into a ship, aircraft, train, or other vehicle.
abode: An abode is a place of residence; a house or home.
abolish: To abolish means to formally put an end to a system, practice, or institution.
abolition: Abolition is the act of abolishing a system, practice, or institution.
abolitionist: An abolitionist is a person who favors the abolition of a practice or institution.
abominable: Abominable means causing moral revulsion; very bad or unpleasant.
abominable_snowman: The Abominable Snowman is a large, hairy, humanoid creature said to live in the Himalayas.
abominate: To abominate means to detest or loathe intensely.
abomination: An abomination is a thing that causes disgust or hatred.
aboriginal: Aboriginal means inhabiting or existing in a land from the earliest times.
aborigine: An aborigine is a person, animal, or plant that has been in a country or region from earliest times.
abort: To abort means to carry out or undergo the abortion of a fetus.
abortion: Abortion is the deliberate termination of a human pregnancy.
abortive: Abortive means failing to produce the intended result.
abound: To abound means to exist in large numbers or amounts.
about: About means on the subject of; concerning.
about-face: An about-face is a complete change of attitude or opinion.
above: Above means in extended space over and not touching.
aboveboard: Aboveboard means legitimate, honest, and open.
abracadabra: Abracadabra is a word said by magicians when performing a magic trick.
abrade: To abrade means to scrape or wear away by friction or erosion.
abrasion: An abrasion is an area damaged by scraping or wearing away.
abrasive: Abrasive means showing little concern for the feelings of others; harsh.
abreast: Abreast means side by side and facing the same way.
abridge: To abridge means to shorten a book, movie, or other text without losing the sense.
abridged: Abridged means shortened without losing the essential content.
abridgment: An abridgment is a shortened version of a larger work.
abroad: Abroad means in or to a foreign country or countries.
abrogate: To abrogate means to repeal or do away with a law, right, or formal agreement.
abrogation: Abrogation is the repeal or abolition of a law, right, or agreement.
abscess: An abscess is a swollen area within body tissue containing pus.
abscissa: An abscissa is the x-coordinate in a system of Cartesian coordinates.
abscond: To abscond means to leave hurriedly and secretly to escape from custody.
abseil: To abseil means to descend a rock face or other near-vertical surface using a rope.
absence: Absence is the state of being away from a place or person.
absent: Absent means not present in a place, at an occasion, or as part of something.
absentee: An absentee is a person who is expected or required to be present but is not.
absenteeism: Absenteeism is the practice of regularly staying away from work without good reason.
absinthe: Absinthe is a green anise-flavored liqueur.
absolute: Absolute means not qualified or diminished in any way; total.
absolutely: Absolutely means with no qualification, restriction, or limitation.
absolution: Absolution is formal release from guilt, obligation, or punishment.
absolutism: Absolutism is the acceptance of or belief in absolute principles.
absolve: To absolve means to set or declare someone free from blame, guilt, or responsibility.
absorb: To absorb means to take in or soak up liquid or another substance.
absorbed: Absorbed means deeply interested or involved.
absorbent: Absorbent means able to soak up liquid easily.
absorption: Absorption is the process by which one thing absorbs another.
abstain: To abstain means to restrain oneself from doing or enjoying something.
abstainer: An abstainer is a person who abstains from something, especially alcohol.
abstemious: Abstemious means not self-indulgent, especially when eating and drinking.
abstention: Abstention is an instance of declining to vote for or against a proposal.
abstinence: Abstinence is the practice of restraining oneself from indulging in something.
abstract: Abstract means existing in thought or as an idea but not having a physical existence.
abstracted: Abstracted means lacking concentration on what is happening around one.
abstraction: Abstraction is the quality of dealing with ideas rather than events.
abstruse: Abstruse means difficult to understand; obscure.
absurd: Absurd means wildly unreasonable, illogical, or inappropriate.
absurdity: Absurdity is the quality or state of being ridiculous or wildly unreasonable.
abundance: Abundance is a very large quantity of something.
abundant: Abundant means existing or available in large quantities; plentiful.
abuse: Abuse is the improper use of something or cruel treatment of someone.
abuser: An abuser is a person who treats someone with cruelty or violence.
abusive: Abusive means extremely offensive and insulting.
abut: To abut means to be next to or have a common boundary with.
abutment: An abutment is a structure built to support the lateral pressure of an arch or span.
abuzz: Abuzz means filled with a continuous humming or buzzing sound.
abyss: An abyss is a deep or seemingly bottomless chasm.
abyssal: Abyssal means relating to the depths of the ocean.
